author: Sean McLain
title: U.S. Tax Cut Gives Honda a Bump
text:
TOKYO—Honda Motor Co. raised its profit forecast for the year on strong vehicle sales in Asia and a one-time boost from changes in U.S. tax law.
The Japanese auto maker said Friday it expects to earn ¥1 trillion ($9.1 billion) for the year ending in March, up from its previous forecast of ¥585 billion, reflecting a one-off gain that added ¥346 billion to its net profit for the October-December quarter.
